timeline.body:
```suggestion
		return function == Functions.LETTER || function == Functions.JOIN2 || function == Functions.JOIN3 || function == Functions.REGEX;
```
Might be easier to understand for future developers who need to maintain the code. Of course this needs to be changed everywhere else as well. If it makes troubles with compatibility, we can also only use the JOIN3, but keep JOIN (without the 2) for the variant with two parameters.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
return function == Functions.LETTER || function == Functions.JOIN || function == Functions.JOIN2 || function == Functions.REGEX;
return function == Functions.LETTER || function == Functions.JOIN2 || function == Functions.JOIN3 || function == Functions.REGEX;

Might be easier to understand for future developers who need to maintain the code. Of course this needs to be changed everywhere else as well. If it makes troubles with compatibility, we can also only use the JOIN3, but keep JOIN (without the 2) for the variant with two parameters.
timeline.author: wslany

replies.bodyText: refactored JOIN -> JOIN2 and used JOIN3 for new functionality
replies.author: christophsiegl

timeline.body: I just found this code part. Actually, all the textual strings in https://github.com/Catrobat/Catroid/blob/b71d974b33fe16a7688871a6d2a105bd0a872923/catroid/src/main/java/org/catrobat/catroid/formulaeditor/InternFormulaKeyboardAdapter.java#L161-L186 such as here "hello" and "world" should in fact instead be resources in strings.xml that can be translated by our translators. Not sure if you want to do it in this ticket, or whether we make a new one. LMK.
timeline.bodyHTML:
I just found this code part. Actually, all the textual strings in

Catroid/catroid/src/main/java/org/catrobat/catroid/formulaeditor/InternFormulaKeyboardAdapter.java

Lines 161 to 186 in b71d974

return buildDoubleParameterFunction(Functions.LETTER, NUMBER, "1",
STRING, "hello world");
case R.string.formula_editor_function_length:
return buildSingleParameterFunction(Functions.LENGTH, STRING, "hello world");
case R.string.formula_editor_function_number_of_items:
return buildSingleParameterFunction(Functions.NUMBER_OF_ITEMS, USER_LIST, "list name");
case R.string.formula_editor_function_join:
return buildDoubleParameterFunction(Functions.JOIN, STRING, "hello",
STRING, " world");
case R.string.formula_editor_function_join2:
return buildTripleParameterFunction(Functions.JOIN2, STRING, "hello",
STRING, " world", STRING, "!");
case R.string.formula_editor_function_regex:
return buildDoubleParameterFunction(Functions.REGEX, STRING, " an? ([^ .]+)",
STRING, "I am a panda.");
case R.string.formula_editor_function_list_item:
return buildDoubleParameterFunction(Functions.LIST_ITEM, NUMBER, "1",
USER_LIST, "list name");
case R.string.formula_editor_function_contains:
return buildDoubleParameterFunction(Functions.CONTAINS,
USER_LIST, "list name",
NUMBER, "1");
case R.string.formula_editor_function_index_of_item:
return buildDoubleParameterFunction(Functions.INDEX_OF_ITEM,
NUMBER, "1",
USER_LIST, "list_name");
such as here "hello" and "world" should in fact instead be resources in strings.xml that can be translated by our translators. Not sure if you want to do it in this ticket, or whether we make a new one. LMK.
timeline.author: wslany

replies.bodyText: Unfortunately I have no time left. Please create a separate ticket.
replies.author: christophsiegl

timeline.body:
```suggestion
		secondParameter = "string'**##!§\"$\'§%\"%/&%(())??";
```
Let's check " as well. Should be OK, but maybe needs \\\" instead of just \"
timeline.bodyHTML:

secondParameter = "string'**##!§\"$\'§%%/&%(())??";
secondParameter = "string'**##!§\"$\'§%\"%/&%(())??";

Let's check " as well. Should be OK, but maybe needs \" instead of just "
